channel.title: PI - Walkable interface
channel.description: I'm trying to create a walkable interface for a minigame, but it doesn't stay, it appears briefly and disappears. If I stick it in process(), which I obviously want to avoid, it just blinks on and off. Anyone know how to do this properly? My code seems to be the exact same as any other walkable interface that's already been set up.

item.title: PI - Walkable interface
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

I figured out why this wasn’t working. In the process method in Client.java there’s something that sets your walkableinterface to -1 if you aren’t in an area that has one. You just have to make an exception for your area.

Read full topic

item.title: PI - Walkable interface
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Clawz fury:

I had this problem, and figured out that some interfaces cannot be used as walkable interfaces (I was trying to use the npc dialogue interface to display text at the top of the screen). Which interface are you using?

Which interfaces did you have problems with? I can’t see anything in the client that would cause that, but I’d love to look into it further!

Read full topic

@n10si_t wrote:

Oh well I’ll be! I hadn’t quite thought of that. That’s really helpful. You rock, man. You really do.

item.title: PI - Walkable interface
item.dc:creator: @DeltaMax DeltaMax
item.description:
@DeltaMax wrote:

Try to use the setInterfaceWalkable(interface ID) method, I think that should work
